outputs.output_descr: This project sets out to minimize the overlapping and conflicting natural resource and environmental policies relevant to the goals and principles of the Convention of Biological Diversity, United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification and United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change, as well as to fill identified policy gaps.  The multitude of legislation and associated responsible departments will be rationalized in terms of cost-effectiveness and attainment of immediate objectives, such as the development and implementation of co-managed projects among multiple departments that produce synergies.  Both government and non-state stakeholders will be better enabled to undertake activities that are mutually supportive of each other, including co-managed projects (such as integrated resource management projects).

project_descr: Strengthening Institutional Capacities for Coordinating Multi-Sectoral Environmental Policies and Programmes
project_title: Strengthening Capacities to Coordinate RIO Conventions
